Package fr.campus.loic.squaregames.model.persistence

Class GameFileRepository

java.lang.Object
fr.campus.loic.squaregames.model.persistence.GameFileRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
Repository
public class GameFileRepository extends Object implements Repository
Handles persistence operations for saving and loading game data such as players and boards.

This repository provides serialization-based persistence for IPlayer and Board objects. Each object is stored as a .ser file inside the saves/ directory.

The directory is automatically created at runtime if it does not exist.

  • Method Details

    • createPlayerFile

      public void createPlayerFile(IPlayer player) throws IOException
      Saves a player instance to a serialized file.

      The player is saved in the saves/ directory under the name player_{number}.ser, where {number} is the player's identifier.

      Specified by:
      createPlayerFile in interface Repository
      Parameters:
      player - the IPlayer instance to save
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file

    • readPlayerFile

      public IPlayer readPlayerFile(int number) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads a player instance from a serialized file.
      Specified by:
      readPlayerFile in interface Repository
      Parameters:
      number - the identifier of the player to load
      Returns:
      the deserialized IPlayer instance
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class definition of the serialized object is not found

    • createBoardFile

      public void createBoardFile(Board board) throws IOException
      Saves a game board to a serialized file.

      The board is stored under the name board_{size}.ser. Future improvements may include adding unique game IDs instead of relying on board size.

      Specified by:
      createBoardFile in interface Repository
      Parameters:
      board - the Board instance to save
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file

    • readBoardFile

      public Board readBoardFile(int id) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads a game board from a serialized file.
      Specified by:
      readBoardFile in interface Repository
      Parameters:
      id - the board identifier (currently the board size)
      Returns:
      the deserialized Board instance
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class definition of the serialized object is not found
